messages: b4eaa1041eea7bdf194c4e8ba5951071 (02:00): hi folks -- i need some help -- im trying to set up a samba file server to authenticate against my active directory server -- i have the Samba Guide for ADS membership but im on gentoo and i dont know what i need to have emerged in order for this to make it work - -is there a file listing someplace of what i need to go get?
6ca5794fc9e2ec354c9200e467c9afea (02:04): W8TAH: http://www.tkrin.net/22/
6ca5794fc9e2ec354c9200e467c9afea (02:05): W8TAH: you need ldap and kerberos compiled into samba

6ca5794fc9e2ec354c9200e467c9afea (02:10): yeah

6ca5794fc9e2ec354c9200e467c9afea (02:11): wish i could be more help

8086e54bad8cadcccbac1db2b7dd5595 (02:30): I can't see my Window XP box/shares from my SAMBA workstation... anybody hear of this problem?
8086e54bad8cadcccbac1db2b7dd5595 (02:31): I CAN see my Linux SAMBA servers though
8086e54bad8cadcccbac1db2b7dd5595 (02:32): My workstation is a Debian box running GNOME.... and I'm trying to access them via NETWORK SERVERS app.
8086e54bad8cadcccbac1db2b7dd5595 (02:37): Let me update that... I can see my windows XP box, but it says "Sorry, couldn't display ll the content of Windows Network:WINSERVER"??
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (02:38): firewall
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (02:39): uptownben: try smbclient
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (02:39): some of the gui's just dont work very well
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (02:39): well, for browsing.  direct access is usualy ok
8086e54bad8cadcccbac1db2b7dd5595 (02:47): I had a problem before because I had a . in my WORKGROUP name. I removed it and now all the fileservers appear in NETWORK SERVERS gui, but ...wit a minute...
8086e54bad8cadcccbac1db2b7dd5595 (02:47): I have a wierd name resolution problem here..
8086e54bad8cadcccbac1db2b7dd5595 (02:47): my LM names don't resolve..
8086e54bad8cadcccbac1db2b7dd5595 (02:48): I have Linux box with the SMB name DEV, I should be able to type ping DEV to ping it shouldn't I?
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (02:49): not linux ping
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (02:50): unless you install winbind a add WINS to your nsswitch.conf
8086e54bad8cadcccbac1db2b7dd5595 (02:50): I'll try pinging from my XP box...
98dc40de8c10641d8f530a1609692ec5 (02:50): ouch winbind has nothing to do with wins
8086e54bad8cadcccbac1db2b7dd5595 (02:51): pinging from my XP box works...
8086e54bad8cadcccbac1db2b7dd5595 (02:51): anybody got any ideas on how I can resolve a WINS name lookup problem
8086e54bad8cadcccbac1db2b7dd5595 (02:52): from my LINUX boxes?
98dc40de8c10641d8f530a1609692ec5 (02:52): add 'wins' to your hosts line in /etc/nsswitch.conf
f9c5eef23e4e79ee735a7bab11bfa729 (02:53): so funny how WINS just refuses to go away. ;)
8086e54bad8cadcccbac1db2b7dd5595 (02:54): do I need to restart something?
98dc40de8c10641d8f530a1609692ec5 (02:54): its a lobc feature
8086e54bad8cadcccbac1db2b7dd5595 (02:56): I added it... but it still not resolving the WINS names...
8086e54bad8cadcccbac1db2b7dd5595 (02:56): in nsswitch.conf I set: hosts: files wins dns
8086e54bad8cadcccbac1db2b7dd5595 (02:56): correct?
98dc40de8c10641d8f530a1609692ec5 (02:57): look for a lib named libnss_wins.so
8086e54bad8cadcccbac1db2b7dd5595 (02:58): searcing. . .
8086e54bad8cadcccbac1db2b7dd5595 (02:58): aand if I don't have that?
8086e54bad8cadcccbac1db2b7dd5595 (02:58): apt-get install...??
8086e54bad8cadcccbac1db2b7dd5595 (02:59): I don't have it :(
8086e54bad8cadcccbac1db2b7dd5595 (02:59): nope
98dc40de8c10641d8f530a1609692ec5 (03:00): with the SuSE its in the package samba3-winbind
98dc40de8c10641d8f530a1609692ec5 (03:00): ||cw: youre right in this point
8086e54bad8cadcccbac1db2b7dd5595 (03:00): I see libnss_dns... libnss_files...
8086e54bad8cadcccbac1db2b7dd5595 (03:01): Debian? winbind?
8086e54bad8cadcccbac1db2b7dd5595 (03:05): OK... so now I can ping by name, but my network browser GUI still says it can't show me contents, but smbclient does...
